name: Ecuador
description: Ecuador, a land of dramatic contrasts, straddles the equator and boasts an astonishing diversity of ecosystems, from the snow-capped Andes Mountains to the Amazon rainforest and the Pacific coast. Known as 'La Delicia de Ensueño' (The Delightful Dream), Ecuador offers a unique blend of indigenous cultures, colonial history, and breathtaking natural beauty. Its stable economy and welcoming people make it an increasingly popular destination for travelers and researchers alike.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The historic capital city, nestled high in the Andes.
quickFacts.detail: Quito is a UNESCO World Heritage site, renowned for its well-preserved colonial architecture and vibrant cultural scene.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A diverse population with strong indigenous roots.
quickFacts.detail: Ecuador is home to over 36 officially recognized indigenous groups, each with its own unique traditions and languages.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small but incredibly diverse country.
quickFacts.detail: Ecuador's size belies its incredible biodiversity, encompassing a wide range of habitats.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Quechua and Shuar are also official languages, reflecting the country's indigenous heritage.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The US Dollar was adopted in 2000, stabilizing the economy after a period of hyperinflation.

quickFacts.label: Elevation
quickFacts.detail: Mount Chimborazo, located in the Andes, is the furthest point from the Earth's center.

climateData.title: Ecuadorian Climate
climateData.description: Ecuador experiences a wide range of climates due to its varied topography. The Andes Mountains have cool, alpine climates, while the Amazon rainforest is hot and humid. The coastal regions are generally mild and dry, and the Galapagos Islands boast a unique subtropical climate.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (December - March)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and humid, with frequent rainfall, particularly in the Amazon and coastal regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (April - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Transition period with decreasing rainfall and pleasant temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Dry season in the highlands, with cool temperatures and clear skies. The coast is sunny and dry.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Increasing rainfall and warmer temperatures, with blooming flowers and lush vegetation.

naturalWonders.name: Galapagos Islands
naturalWonders.description: A volcanic archipelago renowned for its unique wildlife, including giant tortoises, marine iguanas, and blue-footed boobies. These islands played a crucial role in Charles Darwin's theory of evolution.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Galapagos Islands are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a living laboratory of evolution. Their isolation has allowed unique species to develop, making them one of the most remarkable destinations on Earth.

naturalWonders.name: Amazon Rainforest (Yasuni National Park)
naturalWonders.description: A vast expanse of tropical rainforest teeming with biodiversity, home to countless plant and animal species, including jaguars, monkeys, and colorful birds.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Yasuni National Park, located in the Ecuadorian Amazon, is one of the most biodiverse places on the planet. It’s a critical area for carbon sequestration and plays a vital role in regulating the global climate.

naturalWonders.name: Cotopaxi Volcano
naturalWonders.description: A towering, snow-capped volcano in the Andes Mountains, offering stunning views and challenging hiking opportunities.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Cotopaxi is one of the highest active volcanoes in the world and a symbol of Ecuador. Its perfectly symmetrical cone is a popular destination for mountaineers and photographers.

biodiversityCategory.name: Birds
biodiversityCategory.description: Ecuador is a paradise for birdwatchers, boasting an incredible diversity of avian species, including hummingbirds, macaws, and condors.

statistics.details: Ecuador is home to over 1400 species of hummingbirds, more than any other country in the world.
Twenty species of macaws inhabit Ecuador's forests, including the scarlet macaw and the blue-and-gold macaw.

notableSpecies.name: Andean Condor
notableSpecies.significance: One of the largest flying birds in the world, a symbol of the Andes Mountains.

notableSpecies.name: Blue-footed Booby
notableSpecies.significance: Famous for its bright blue feet, a unique species found only in the Galapagos Islands.

ecosystemData.title: Ecuadorian Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Ecuador’s diverse geography supports a wide range of ecosystems, including the Amazon rainforest, the Andes Mountains, the Pacific coast, and the Galapagos Islands. These ecosystems are interconnected and play a vital role in the country’s biodiversity and economy.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mammals
biodiversityCategories.description: Ecuador is home to a variety of mammals, including jaguars, pumas, spectacled bears, and capybaras.

statistics.details: The jaguar is the largest cat in the Americas and a symbol of the Amazon rainforest.

notableSpecies.name: Spectacled Bear
notableSpecies.significance: Also known as the Andean bear, it is the only bear species native to South America.

activities.title: Ecuadorian Adventures
activities.description: Ecuador offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and trekking to wildlife viewing and water sports.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Ecuador’s stunning landscapes on foot, from the Andes Mountains to the Amazon rainforest.

activities.name: Cotopaxi Hike
activities.description: A challenging trek to the base of Cotopaxi Volcano, offering breathtaking views and a chance to experience the high-altitude Andes.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, warm clothing

activities.name: Amazon Trek
activities.description: Immerse yourself in the heart of the Amazon rainforest, exploring its diverse flora and fauna.
activities.requirements: Insect repellent, long sleeves and pants, waterproof gear

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities along Ecuador’s Pacific coast and in its rivers and lakes.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Catch some waves on Ecuador’s world-class surf breaks.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore Ecuador’s rivers and lakes by kayak, observing wildlife and enjoying the scenery.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, first-aid kit
